intro: Mortoniodendron, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine, velvety hairs. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that are often clustered in terminal inflorescences. Mortoniodendron is native to Central and South America and thrives in warm, humid environments. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields.
